basics.name: Nicolas Pielawski
basics.label: Researcher
basics.summary: Nicolas is a postdoctoral researcher working at the intersection of healthcare and artificial intelligence, with a focus on deep learning, Bayesian statistics and information theory. His background includes work in medical imaging, and his current research explores how principled approaches to uncertainty, prediction, and inference can drive meaningful progress in health data science and clinical AI.

work.name: Postdoctoral Researcher at Uppsala University
work.summary: I am developing methods for predicting the risks incurred by patients visiting the emergency department using both deep learning and statistical methods.

work.name: Internship at the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard
work.summary: I worked on the development of a new method for reconstructing tissues spatially from transcriptomic data.

work.name: Uppsala University
work.position: PhD Student in Biomedical Image Analysis
work.summary: I developped methods for multimodal image registration using deep learning. I also contributed to the development of TissUUmaps, a tool for interactive visualization and exploration of large-scale spatial omics data.

work.name: ThyssenKrupp Budapest
work.summary: I added functionalities to a custom software for testing steering wheel embedded system.

work.name: ThyssenKrupp Presta France
work.summary: I implemented softwares for improving the efficiency of steering wheels production lines. I also worked on the development of a network device for debugging defective production line automatons.
